title: AI nursing ethics: Viability of robots and artificial intelligence in nursing practice
summary:
Can Robots Replace Human Nurses? A Study on the Ethical Implications

Researchers from Tokyo University of Science, The University of Tokyo, and Kyoritsu Women's University explored whether robots and AI can be trusted with nursing tasks. They examined whether robots can replicate the ethical concepts attributed to human nurses, such as advocacy, accountability, cooperation, and caring. While AI can inform patients and present treatment options, its ability to understand and empathize with patients' values and navigate human relationships is questioned. The researchers also highlighted the importance of developing explainable AI and determining the appropriate appearance of robots for efficient cooperation with human medical staff. The study acknowledges that robots may not fully replace human nurses, but further research is needed to address ethical questions and potential applications.
